com.turing123.robotframe

Class RobotFrameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.turing123.robotframe.RobotFrameManager

  • public class RobotFrameManager
extends java.lang.Object

    The entry to use RobotFrame.

    Usage:
    The method prepare must be called prior to any method calling on this frame. The normal steps to use this frame are as blow:
    1. call getInstance()
    2. call prepare(prepareListener)
    3. waiting for prepareListener callback
    4.1 if success, call start() to launch the robot up
    4.2 if error occurred, check and fix the issue according to error message
    5. if robot is attempting to shutdown, call method shutDown(shutdownListener) first and wait until the shutdownListener called back.

    WARNING: Any violation from the steps above will cause unpredictable behaviors.

      • setChatMode

        public void setChatMode(int mode)
        Set RobotFrame's default chat mode, default mode is auto mode. Notice: After RobotFrame prepared call it will be invalid.
        Parameters:
        mode - chat mode.
        See Also:
        SystemConfig.CHAT_MODE_AUTO, SystemConfig.CHAT_MODE_MANUAL

        listener - the callback listener

      • toLostScenario

        public IScenario toLostScenario()
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        If you called this method, The robot will lost itself, it will do whatever you say to do when it is in interactive state. If you lost yourself, if you want to get your mind back again, You need call backMainScenario() method as your only way.
        Returns:
        Instance of lost scenario.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • backMainScenario

        public boolean backMainScenario()
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        If you are in lost scenario, but you want back to main scenario, call me!
        Returns:
        If success return True, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
